lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Yong.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Yong.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Parser class to decipher the input of the chatbot and call the correct command.
* @param taskList TaskList object being used to maintain the list of tasks in the chatbot.
* Method to parse the string input of the chatbot and call the correct command.
* @param inp Line of input from the CLI.
* @return Command object that will be executed.
throw new DukeException("I do not know what you are saying.");
* Storage class to handle file storage, creation and reading of saved file.
* @param taskList TaskList object being used to maintain the list of tasks in the chatbot.
* Saves the current history array to the file
System.out.println("File is not found! But this shouldn't happen LOL");
* Reads the file to populate the history array
System.out.println("File is not found! But this shouldn't happen LOL");
System.out.println("There is an error occurring, " + e.getMessage());
* UI class to handle UI methods.
* Initializes a scanner to read user input.
* Reads the next line of user input.
* @return User input in a string format.
* Prints out a line to delineate actions.
* @param errorMessage Error message to be printed.
* Chatbot named YONG that responds to user input using CLI
* Represents a command given by the user. Parent class with abstract execute() method.
* @param taskList TaskList object being used to maintain the list of tasks in the chatbot.
* Abstract method to be implemented for all commands.
* To be run when the command is entered by the user.
* Returns whether the command entered by the user is an Exit command.
* @return true if it is an exit command, false otherwise
* Represents the actions needed if the user inputs a deadline task
* @param taskList TaskList object being used to maintain the list of tasks in the chatbot.
* @param inp Line of input from the CLI
* Method to be executed when this command is called.
* Initializes a new Deadline object and adds it to the taskList.
throw new DukeException("Please give a valid description for a Deadline task!");
* Class representing actions run when the delete command is called by user.
* @param taskList TaskList object being used to maintain the list of tasks in the chatbot.
* @param numberString Parsed string input from the CLI, represents task to be deleted.
* Method to be executed when this command is called.
* Deletes the specified task by the user.
System.out.println("YONG has deleted this task for you! \n" + task.toString());
* Represents the actions needed if the user inputs an event task
* @param taskList TaskList object being used to maintain the list of tasks in the chatbot.
* @param inp Line of input from the CLI
* Method to be executed when this command is called.
* Initializes an Event object and adds it to the taskList.
Task newTask = new Event(description, from, to);
throw new DukeException("Please give a valid description for an Event task!");
* Represents the actions needed if the user inputs an Exit command.
* @param taskList TaskList object being used to maintain the list of tasks in the chatbot.
* Method to be executed when this command is called.
* Prints out the end statement of the chatbot.
System.out.println("Thank you and have a good day!");
* Represents the actions needed if the user inputs a deadline task
* @param taskList TaskList object being used to maintain the list of tasks in the chatbot.
* @param inp      Line of input from the CLI
* Method to be executed when this command is called.
* Prints out the tasks that contain the keyword.
throw new DukeException("Please give a valid description for the find command");
* Represents the actions needed if the user inputs a list command.
* @param taskList TaskList object being used to maintain the list of tasks in the chatbot.
* Method to be executed when this command is called.
* Prints out all tasks in the tasklist in the specified format.
* Represents the actions needed if the user inputs a mark command.
* @param taskList TaskList object being used to maintain the list of tasks in the chatbot.
* @param numberString Line of input from the CLI.
* Method to be executed when this command is called.
* Marks the specified task as being completed.
System.out.println("YONG has marked this task as completed! \n" + task.toString());
* Represents the actions needed when the user says Hi.
* @param taskList TaskList object being used to maintain the list of tasks in the chatbot.
* Method to be executed when this command is called.
* Prints out the chatbot name and introduces itself.
* Represents the actions needed if the user inputs a todo task.
* @param taskList TaskList object being used to maintain the list of tasks in the chatbot.
* @param inp Line of input from the CLI
* Method to be executed when this command is called.
* Initializes a new ToDo object and adds it to the taskList.
throw new DukeException("Please give a valid description for a ToDo task!");
* Represents the actions needed if the user inputs an unmark command.
* @param taskList TaskList object being used to maintain the list of tasks in the chatbot.
* @param numberString Parsed number input from the CLI.
* Method to be executed when this command is called.
* Initializes a new Deadline object and adds it to the tasklist.
System.out.println("YONG has unmarked this task successfully! \n" + task.toString() + "\n");
* Class to handle exceptions due to incorrect user input.
* Represents the list of tasks in the chatbot.
* Marks the specified task as being done.
* @param number Number of the task, starting from index 1.
* @return The task being marked as done.
* Unmarks the specified task as being done.
* @param number Number of the task, starting from index 1.
* @param number Number of the task, starting from index 1.
* Adds a specific task to the tasklist.
* @param task Task object to be added.
* Prints out all the task in the tasklist.
* Returns the task list as an ArrayList object to be stored.
* Allows the task list to be set after reading the saved file.

return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
